topics.content: Natural numbers are counting numbers starting from 1, such as 1, 2, 3 and so on.
Whole numbers include all natural numbers and zero.
A number line is a straight line on which numbers are shown at equal distances.
The successor of a number is one more than the number, and the predecessor is one less.
Whole numbers follow properties like closure, commutativity and associativity.
Integers include positive numbers, negative numbers and zero.
Addition of integers depends on the signs of the numbers being added.
Subtraction of integers can be understood using a number line.
Operations are performed in a fixed order: brackets, multiplication, division, addition and subtraction.
Brackets are used to group numbers and decide the order of operations.
Factors are numbers that divide another number exactly.
Multiples are numbers obtained by multiplying a number by whole numbers.
Prime numbers have only two factors, while composite numbers have more than two factors.
A fraction represents a part of a whole.
Fractions can be proper, improper or mixed.
Equivalent fractions represent the same value though they look different.
Decimal numbers are numbers with a decimal point.
Digits after the decimal point represent tenths, hundredths and so on.
A variable is a symbol used to represent an unknown number.
An algebraic expression is a combination of variables and numbers using operations.
A linear equation in one variable has only one variable with power one.
Solving a linear equation means finding the value of the variable that makes the equation true.
Ratio compares two quantities of the same kind.
Proportion states that two ratios are equal.
Unitary method is used to find the value of a single unit.
A line has no fixed length and extends endlessly in both directions.
A line segment has a fixed length with two end points.
A ray has one end point and extends endlessly in one direction.

chapters.chapter: Parallel Lines, Angles and Their Measurements

topics.content: Parallel lines never meet and are always at the same distance from each other.
An angle is formed when two lines meet at a point.
Angles can be acute, obtuse, right or straight.
Perimeter is the total distance around a closed shape.
Area is the space covered by a closed shape.
A line of symmetry divides a shape into two equal halves.
Shapes that can be divided into equal halves are called symmetrical shapes.
Data is a collection of information in numerical form.
A bar graph represents data using rectangular bars.
